fields.Explanation: The name of the Transportation Asset. This value can be referenced in other tables involving Transportation Assets.
The units of this Asset that are available at the specified Base Location. If left blank, this is assumed to be an infinite amount of available assets
The Facility at which the Asset is based. Units of this Asset will be located at the Base Location at the beginning of the model run.
The max distance a vehicle can travel empty to its first pickup location. This useful to allow vehicles to start from a depot separate from a distribution center
The unit of measure (Type = Distance) that defines the max distance to first pickup.

The schedule (defined in the Business Hours table) dictating when the Transportation Asset will be available. The vehicle must start and finish its route within one continuous business hours window. If no schedule is specified, the asset can be used all day.
Status dictates whether or not the Asset exists in the model. If Status is set to Exclude, the Asset is ignored in all tables. The Asset will be dropped from policies that reference it.
The name of the Transportation Rate. This value can be referenced in other tables involving Transportation Rates.

The type of the rate defined in the TransportationRates table. For LastDestination and FurthestDestination, Hopper will look up the correct rate using the RouteDestinationName column in the TransportationRates table. LastDestination will use the site with the last delivery in the route while FurthestDestination will use the furthest customer from the DC in the route.
The name of the Transportation Stop Rate.
The one-time fixed cost incurred per unit of the Asset used in the model run.
The capacity (quantity) of the Asset. The most restrictive capacity given in this record (among quantity, volume, and weight) will be applied to the Asset.
The unit of measure (Type = Quantity) that defines Quantity Capacity.
The fill level of the Asset (quantity). Quantity Fill Level is the minimum quantity of items required for the Asset to depart.
The unit of measure (Type = Quantity) that defines Quantity Fill Level.
The capacity (volume) of the Asset. The most restrictive capacity given in this record (among quantity, volume, and weight) will be applied to the Asset.
The unit of measure (Type = Volume) that defines Volume Capacity.
The fill level of the Asset (volume). Volume Fill Level is the minimum volume of items required for the Asset to depart.
The unit of measure (Type = Volume) that defines Volume Fill Level.
The capacity (weight) of the Asset. The most restrictive capacity given in this record (among quantity, volume, and weight) will be applied to the Asset.
The unit of measure (Type = Weight) that defines Weight Capacity.
The fill level of the Asset (weight). Weight Fill Level is the minimum volume of items required for the Asset to depart.
The unit of measure (Type = Weight) that defines Weight Fill Level.
The max distance of each route that this Asset can be assigned to.
The unit of measure (Type = Distance) that defines Max Distance Per Route.
If a distance between two stops is smaller than the MinDistanceBetweenStopsOverride, we use this value instead. This is not a constraint, just an override.
The unit of measure that is used for the min distance between stops override.
The maximum distance allowed between two stops at a customer in a route.
The unit of measure that is used for the max distance between stops constraint.
The max time of each route that this Asset can be assigned to.
The unit of measure (Type = Time) that defines Max Time Per Route.
The max wait time at each stop for this asset.
The unit of measure (Type = Time) that defines Max Wait Time At Stop.
The max wait time within each route that this Asset can be assigned to.
The unit of measure (Type = Time) that defines Max Wait Time Per Route.
The max number of stops that can be on a route that this Asset is assigned to.
The max number of pickup stops that can be on a route that this Asset is assigned to.
The max number of delivery stops that can be on a route that this Asset is assigned to.
The minimum number of routes required in a tour (asset schedule) over the model horizon.
The maximum number of routes allowed in a tour (asset schedule) over the model horizon.
The maximum length of a tour (asset schedule) over the model horizon. This is calculated as the time between the start of the first route and the end of the last route for the asset.
The unit of measure (Type = Time) that defines the Max Time Per Tour.
The maximum distance of a tour (asset schedule) over the model horizon. This is calculated as the sum of the distances of all routes in the tour.
The unit of measure (Type = Distance) that defines the Max Distance Per Tour.
The minimum time between the end of a route and the start of the next route assigned to the same tour.
The unit of measure (Type = Time) that defines the Min Time Between Routes.
The speed that the Asset will travel at.
The unit of measure that defines the Asset Speed.
The fixed time required at the pickup locations for this Asset. This will be additive to the FixedPickupTime specified in the Facilities, Customers and Shipments tables.
The unit of measure (Type = Time) that defines Fixed Pickup Time.
The fixed time required at the delivery locations for this Asset. This will be additive to the FixedDeliveryTime specified in the Facilities, Customers and Shipments tables.
The unit of measure (Type = Time) that defines Fixed Delivery Time
The time required per unit to be loaded onto this Asset at the pickup locations. This will be additive to any UnitPickupTime that is specified in the Facilities, Customers and Shipments tables.
The unit of measure (Type = Time) that defines Unit Pickup Time.
The time required per unit to be delivered at destination locations by this Asset. This will be additive to any UnitDeliveryTime that is specified in the Facilities, Customers and Shipments tables.
The unit of measure that defines the basis on which UnitPickupTime and UnitDeliveryTime will be applied for the Shipment. Quantity, Volume, and Weight units of measure are supported.
The unit of measure (Type = Time) that defines Unit Delivery Time.
The fixed time required for administrative paperwork at the at the start of the route.
The unit of measure (Type = Time) that defines Fixed Admin Time At Route Start.
The fixed time required for administrative paperwork at the at the end of the route.
The unit of measure (Type = Time) that defines Fixed Admin Time At Route End.
If True the vehicle will always return to its domicile at the end of the route. If False, the route will end at the last delivery location

If True, shipments will always be delivered in reverse order of their pickup as if they were loaded and unloaded from the back of the vehicle. This is particularly useful for Interleaved and Backhaul models and won't impact standard outbound models.

If False, the clocks for the Transportation Asset will be shared between consecutive routes within a tour. This means that the end of one route will use the same clocks as the beginning of the next route. Otherwise, each route will have independent clocks.
The maximum drive time that can occur within a shift. A rest period happens between two shifts.
The unit of measure (Type = Time) that defines the max drive time within shift.
The maximum duty time that can occur within a shift. Duty time includes any activity that is not a rest between two shifts. So this field controls the length of each shift
The unit of measure (Type = Time) that defines the max duty time within shift.
The minimum rest time that needs to occur between two shifts.
The unit of measure (Type = Time) that defines the rest time between shifts.
The maximum cumulative drive time that is allowed within a route since the last short break or rest. A short break needs to happen when this limit is reached.
The unit of measure (Type = Time) that defines the max drive time before short break.
The maximum cumulative duty time that is allowed within a route since the last short break or rest. A short break needs to happen when this limit is reached.
The unit of measure (Type = Time) that defines the max duty time before short break.
The minimum break time that needs to occur when MaxDriveTimeBeforeShortBreak is reached.
The unit of measure (Type = Time) that defines the short break.
The max out of route distance for each route that this Asset can be assigned to.
The unit of measure (Type = Distance) that defines Max Out of Route Distance.

The max out of route distance Percent for each route that this Asset can be assigned to. This constraint enforces a maximum out of route distance based on a percentage of the total route distance. A value of 50 means 50%.
The weight of the transportation asset when empty. This weight is added to the weight of products being shipped by this asset and will be used for CO2 emission calculations.
The unit of measure of Type = Weight that the asset weight is defined in terms of.
The rate of CO2 emissions for this transportation asset.

fields.Validation Type: ExistsInMasterTable WHERE UnitsOfMeasure.Type = [Distance, Quantity-Distance, Volume-Distance, Weight-Distance]
fields.Explanation: The unit of measure (Type = Distance, Quantity-Distance, Volume-Distance, Weight-Distance) that defines the CO2 Emission Rate. If a UOM of Type = Distance is used, the total distance of the route will be used to calculate CO2 emissions. For composite UOMs, we calculate the CO2 emission for each segment, as segment distance times the load on that segment. For quantity and volume, the load is based on carried shipments only. For weight, we also consider the asset weight.

If provided, this default distance cost will be used whenever a transportation rates cannot be found for a given route. This usually happens when a specific rate combination (eg. last destination) is missing. If not provided, hopper will treat any route without a valid transportation rate as invalid/infeasible.
The calendar (defined in the Business Calendars table) dictating which days of the year the Asset will not be available.
